title: Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API Reference Documentation
description:
# About the REST API

The Wowza Streaming Cloud<sup>TM</sup> REST API (application programming interface) offers complete programmatic control over live streams, transcoders, stream sources, and stream targets. Anything you can do in the Wowza Streaming Cloud UI can also be achieved by making HTTP-based requests to cloud-based servers through the REST API.

The Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API features *cross-origin resource sharing*, or CORS.
CORS is a [W3C specification](https://www.w3.org/TR/cors/) that provides headers in HTTP requests to enable a web server to safely make a network request to another domain.

In order to protect shared resources, the Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API is subject to limits. For details, see [Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API limits](https://www.wowza.com/docs/wowza-streaming-cloud-rest-api-limits).
# About this documentation
This reference documentation is based on the open-source [Swagger framework](http://swagger.io/specification/).
It allows you to view the operations, parameters, and request and reponse schemas for every resource. Request samples are presented in cURL (Shell) and JavaScript; some samples also include just the JSON object. Response samples are all JSON.

For more information and examples on using the Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API, see our [library of Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API technical articles](https://www.wowza.com/docs/wowza-streaming-cloud-rest-api).

# Query requirements
The Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API uses HTTP requests to retrieve data from cloud-based servers. Requests must contain proper JSON, two authentication keys, and the correct version number in the base path.

## JSON
The Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API uses the [JSON API specification](http://jsonapi.org/format/) to request and return data. This means requests must include the header `Content-Type: application/json` and must include a single resource object in JSON format as primary data.

Responses include HTTP status codes that indicate whether the query was successful. If there was an error, a description explains the problem so that you can fix it and try again.

## Authentication
Requests to the Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API must be authenticated with two keys: an API key and an access key. Each key is a 64-character alphanumeric string that you can find on the **API Access** page in Wowza Streaming Cloud.

Use the `wsc-api-key` and `wsc-access-key` headers to authenticate requests, like this (in cURL):

```bash
curl -H 'wsc-api-key: [64-character-api-key-goes-here]' -H 'wsc-access-key: [64-character-access-key-goes-here]'
```

<!-- ReDoc-Inject: <security-definitions> -->

## Version
The Wowza Streaming Cloud API is currently at version 1.0.0. Use `v1` in your base path in every request, like this path to the live_streams endpoint:
```
https://api.cloud.wowza.com/api/v1/live_streams
```
## Example query
Here is a complete example POST request, in cURL, with proper JSON syntax, headers, authentication, and version information:
```bash
curl -H 'wsc-api-key: [64-character-api-key-goes-here]' -H 'wsc-access-key: [64-character-access-key-goes-here]'
  -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -X POST -d '{
    "live_stream": {
      "name": "My live Stream",
      "...": "..."
    }
  }' https://api.cloud.wowza.com/api/v1/live_streams
```

wsc-access-key.label: wsc-access-key (wsc-access-key)
wsc-access-key.note: A valid 64-digit, alphanumeric API access key.

specs.title: Fetch Swagger information
specs.description: This operation shows the details of the Swagger specification.

listLiveStreams.title: Fetch all live streams
listLiveStreams.description: This operation shows the details of all of your live streams.

createLiveStream.title: Create a live stream
createLiveStream.description: This operation creates a live stream.

deleteLiveStream.title: Delete a live stream
deleteLiveStream.description: This operation deletes a live stream, including all assigned outputs and targets.

showLiveStream.title: Fetch a live stream
showLiveStream.description: This operation shows the details of a specific live stream.

updateLiveStream.title: Update a live stream
updateLiveStream.description: This operation updates a live stream.

regenerateConnectionCodeLiveStream.title: Regenerate the connection code for a live stream
regenerateConnectionCodeLiveStream.description: This operation regenerates the connection code of a live stream.

resetLiveStream.title: Reset a live stream
resetLiveStream.description: This operation resets a live stream.

startLiveStream.title: Start a live stream
startLiveStream.description: This operation starts a live stream.

showLiveStreamState.title: Fetch the state of a live stream
showLiveStreamState.description: This operation shows the current state of a live stream.

showLiveStreamStats.title: Fetch metrics for an active live stream
showLiveStreamStats.description: This operation returns a hash of metrics keys, each of which identifies a status, text description, unit, and value.

stopLiveStream.title: Stop a live stream
stopLiveStream.description: This operation stops a live stream.

showLiveStreamThumbnailUrl.title: Fetch the thumbnail URL of a live stream
showLiveStreamThumbnailUrl.description: This operation shows the thumbnail URL of a started live stream.

listPlayers.title: Fetch all players
listPlayers.description: This operation shows the details of all of your players.

showPlayer.title: Fetch a player
showPlayer.description: This operation shows details of a specific player.

requestPlayerRebuild.title: Rebuild player code
requestPlayerRebuild.description: This operation rebuilds the player with the current configuration.

showPlayerState.title: Fetch the state of a player
showPlayerState.description: This operation shows the current state of a player.

listPlayerUrls.title: Fetch all player URLs
listPlayerUrls.description: This operation shows the details of all player URLs.

createPlayerUrl.title: Create a player URL
createPlayerUrl.description: This operation creates a new player URL.

deletePlayerUrl.title: Delete a player URL
deletePlayerUrl.description: This operation deletes a player URL.

showPlayerUrl.title: Fetch a player URL
showPlayerUrl.description: This operation shows the details of a player URL.

updatePlayerUrl.title: Update a player URL
updatePlayerUrl.description: This operation updates a player URL.

listRecordings.title: Fetch all recordings
listRecordings.description: This operation shows the details of all of your recordings.

showRecording.title: Fetch a recording
showRecording.description: This operation shows the details of a specific recording.

showRecordingState.title: Fetch the state of a recording
showRecordingState.description: This operation shows the current state of a recording.

listSchedules.title: Fetch all schedules
listSchedules.description: This operation shows the details of all of your schedules.

showSchedule.title: Fetch a schedule
showSchedule.description: This operation shows the details of a specific schedule.

showScheduleState.title: Fetch the state of a schedule
showScheduleState.description: This operation shows the current state of a schedule.

listStreamSources.title: Fetch all stream sources
listStreamSources.description: This operation shows the details of all of your stream sources.

createStreamSource.title: Add a stream source
createStreamSource.description: This operation adds a stream source.

addStreamSource.title: Deprecated operation
addStreamSource.description: POST /stream_sources/add/ is deprecated. To add a stream source, use POST /stream_sources instead.

deleteStreamSource.title: Delete a stream source
deleteStreamSource.description: This operation deletes a stream source.

showStreamSource.title: Fetch a stream source
showStreamSource.description: This operation shows details of a specific stream source.

updateStreamSource.title: Update a stream source
updateStreamSource.description: This operation updates a stream source.

listStreamTargets.title: Fetch all stream targets
listStreamTargets.description: This operation lists the details of all of your stream targets.

createStreamTarget.title: Create a stream target
createStreamTarget.description: This operation creates a stream target. There are three types of targets that you can create: CustomStreamTarget for an an external, third-party destination; WowzaStreamTarget for a Wowza CDN target; or UltraLowLatencyStreamTarget for an ultra low latency Wowza CDN target. The availability of many parameters depends on the type of target you create.

addStreamTarget.title: Deprecated operation
addStreamTarget.description: POST /stream_targets/add/ is deprecated. To add a stream target, use POST /stream_targets instead.

deleteStreamTarget.title: Delete a stream target
deleteStreamTarget.description: This operation deletes a stream target.

showStreamTarget.title: Fetch a stream target
showStreamTarget.description: This operation shows details of a specific stream target.

updateStreamTarget.title: Update a stream target
updateStreamTarget.description: This operation updates a stream target.

showStreamTargetMetricsCurrent.title: Fetch current health metrics for an active Wowza ultra low latency stream target
showStreamTargetMetricsCurrent.description: This operation returns a snapshot of the current connection and throughput details for an active target whose type is UltraLowLatencyStreamTarget. The interval for current metrics is 30 seconds from the moment of the query.

showStreamTargetMetricsHistoric.title: Fetch historic health metrics for a Wowza ultra low latency stream target
showStreamTargetMetricsHistoric.description: This operation shows historic connection and throughput details for target whose type is UltraLowLatencyStreamTarget.

regenerateConnectionCodeStreamTarget.title: Regenerate the connection code for a stream target
regenerateConnectionCodeStreamTarget.description: This operation regenerates the connection code of a stream target.

showStreamTargetGeoblock.title: Fetch geo-blocking for a stream target
showStreamTargetGeoblock.description: This operation shows the details of geo-blocking applied to a specific stream target. Only stream targets whose type is WowzaStreamTarget can be geo-blocked.

updateStreamTargetGeoblock.title: Update geo-blocking for a stream target
updateStreamTargetGeoblock.description: This operation updates the geo-blocking applied to a stream target. Only stream targets whose type is WowzaStreamTarget can be geo-blocked.

createStreamTargetGeoblock.title: Create geo-blocking for a stream target
createStreamTargetGeoblock.description: This operation allows you to block or whitelist viewing of a stream target by geographic location. Only stream targets whose type is WowzaStreamTarget can be geo-blocked. For more information see the technical article [How to geo-block stream targets by using the Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API](https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-geo-block-stream-targets-by-using-the-wowza-streaming-cloud-rest-api).

listStreamTargetProperties.title: Fetch all properties of a stream target
listStreamTargetProperties.description: This operation shows the details of all of the properties assigned to a specific stream target. Properties can be applied to a CustomStreamTarget or WowzaStreamTarget whose provider is akamai_cupertino.

createStreamTargetProperty.title: Create a property for a stream target
createStreamTargetProperty.description: This operation creates a property for a stream target. Properties can be applied to a CustomStreamTarget or WowzaStreamTarget whose provider is akamai_cupertino. For more information see the technical article [How to set advanced properties by using the Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API](https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-set-advanced-properties-by-using-the-wowza-streaming-cloud-rest-api).

deleteStreamTargetProperty.title: Delete a stream target property
deleteStreamTargetProperty.description: This operation removes a property from a stream target.

showStreamTargetProperty.title: Fetch a property of a stream target
showStreamTargetProperty.description: This operation shows the details of a specific property assigned to a specific stream target. Properties can be applied to a CustomStreamTarget or WowzaStreamTarget whose provider is akamai_cupertino.

showStreamTargetTokenAuth.title: Fetch token authorization for a stream target
showStreamTargetTokenAuth.description: This operation shows the details of the token authorization applied to a stream target. Only stream targets whose type is WowzaStreamTarget can use token authorization.

updateStreamTargetTokenAuth.title: Update token authorization for a stream target
updateStreamTargetTokenAuth.description: This operation updates the token authorization applied to a stream target. Only stream targets whose type is WowzaStreamTarget can use token authorization.

createStreamTargetTokenAuth.title: Create token authorization for a stream target
createStreamTargetTokenAuth.description: This operation creates token authorization for a stream target. Only stream targets whose type is WowzaStreamTarget can use token authorization. For more information see the technical article [How to protect stream targets with token authorization by using the Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API](https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-protect-streams-with-token-authorization-by-using-the-wowza-streaming-cloud-rest-api).

listTranscoders.title: Fetch all transcoders
listTranscoders.description: This operation shows the details of all of your transcoders.

deleteTranscoder.title: Delete a transcoder
deleteTranscoder.description: This operation deletes a transcoder, including all of its assigned output renditions and stream targets.

showTranscoder.title: Fetch a transcoder
showTranscoder.description: This operation shows the details of a specific transcoder.

disableAllStreamTargetsTranscoder.title: Disable a transcoder's stream targets
disableAllStreamTargetsTranscoder.description: This operation disables all of the stream targets assigned to a specific transcoder.

enableAllStreamTargetsTranscoder.title: Enable a transcoder's stream targets
enableAllStreamTargetsTranscoder.description: This operation enables all of the stream targets assigned to a specific transcoder.

listTranscoderRecordings.title: Fetch a transcoder's recordings
listTranscoderRecordings.description: This operation shows the details of all of the recordings for a specific transcoder.

listTranscoderSchedules.title: Fetch transcoder's schedules
listTranscoderSchedules.description: This operation shows the details of all of the schedules for a specific transcoder.

showTranscoderState.title: Fetch the state and uptime ID of a transcoder
showTranscoderState.description: This operation shows the current state and uptime ID of a transcoder.

showTranscoderStats.title: Fetch statistics for a current transcoder
showTranscoderStats.description: This operation responds with a hash of metrics (keys) for a currently running transcoder. Each key has a status, text (description), units, and value.

showTranscoderThumbnailUrl.title: Fetch the thumbnail URL of a transcoder
showTranscoderThumbnailUrl.description: This operation shows the thumbnail URL of a started transcoder.

listTranscoderOutputs.title: Fetch all outputs of a transcoder
listTranscoderOutputs.description: This operation shows the details of all of the output renditions of a specific transcoder.

createTranscoderOutput.title: Create an output
createTranscoderOutput.description: This operation creates an output rendition for a specific transcoder.

deleteTranscoderOutput.title: Delete an output
deleteTranscoderOutput.description: This operation deletes an output, including all of its assigned targets.

showTranscoderOutput.title: Fetch an output
showTranscoderOutput.description: This operation shows the details of a specific output rendition for a specific transcoder.

updateTranscoderOutput.title: Update an output
updateTranscoderOutput.description: This operation updates an output rendition.

addStreamTargetToTranscoderOutput.title: Deprecated operation
addStreamTargetToTranscoderOutput.description: The operation POST /transcoders/{transcoder_id}/outputs/{id}/add_stream_target is deprecated. Use POST /transcoders/{transcoder_id}/outputs/{output_id}/output_stream_targets to add an existing stream target to an output.

removeStreamTargetToTranscoderOutput.title: Deprecated operation
removeStreamTargetToTranscoderOutput.description: The operation DELETE /transcoders/{transcoder_id}/outputs/{id}/remove_stream_target is deprecated. Use DELETE /transcoders/{transcoder_id}/outputs/{output_id}/output_stream_targets/{id} to remove a stream target from an output.

listTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTargets.title: Fetch all output stream targets of an output of a transcoder
listTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTargets.description: This operation shows the details of all of the output stream targets of an output of a transcoder.

createTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.title: Create an output stream target
createTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.description: This operation creates an output stream target. Targets whose type is UltraLowLatencyStreamTarget can't be added to output renditions.

deleteTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.title: Delete an output stream target
deleteTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.description: This operation deletes an output stream target, including all of its assigned targets.

showTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.title: Fetch an output stream target
showTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.description: This operation shows the details of an output stream target.

updateTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.title: Update an output stream target
updateTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.description: This operation updates an output stream target.

disableTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarge.title: Disable an output stream target
disableTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarge.description: This operation disables an output stream target.

enableTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.title: Enable an output stream target
enableTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarget.description: This operation enables an output stream target.

restartTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarge.title: Restart an output stream target
restartTranscoderOutputOutputStreamTarge.description: This operation restarts an output stream target.

listTranscoderProperties.title: Fetch a transcoder's properties
listTranscoderProperties.description: This operation shows all of the properties of a specific transcoder.

createTranscoderProperty.title: Create a property for a transcoder
createTranscoderProperty.description: This operation creates a property for a transcoder. For more information see the technical article [How to set advanced properties by using the Wowza Streaming Cloud REST API](https://www.wowza.com/docs/how-to-set-advanced-properties-by-using-the-wowza-streaming-cloud-rest-api).

deleteTranscoderProperty.title: Delete a transcoder's property
deleteTranscoderProperty.description: This operation deletes a specific property from a specific transcoder.

showTranscoderProperty.title: Fetch a property for a transcoder
showTranscoderProperty.description: This operation shows the details of a specific property for a specific transcoder.

indexUptimes.title: Fetch all uptime records for a transcoder
indexUptimes.description: This operation shows all of the uptime records for a specific transcoder. An uptime record identifies a specific transcoding session.

showUptime.title: Fetch an uptime record
showUptime.description: This operation shows the details of a specific uptime record for a specific transcoder. An uptime record identifies a transcoding session.

showUptimeMetricsCurrent.title: Fetch current stream health metrics for an active transcoder
showUptimeMetricsCurrent.description: This operation returns a snapshot of the current source connection and processing details of an active (running) transcoder.

showUptimeMetricsHistoric.title: Fetch historic stream health metrics for a transcoder
showUptimeMetricsHistoric.description: This operation shows the historic source connection and processing details for a transcoding session (uptime record). The transcoder can be running or stopped. Metrics are recorded every 20 seconds.

usageNetworkStreamSourcesIndex.title: Fetch network usage for all stream sources
usageNetworkStreamSourcesIndex.description: This operation shows the amount of network usage for all stream sources in the account. The default time frame is from the last billing date to the end of the current day.

usageNetworkStreamTargetsIndex.title: Fetch network usage for all stream targets
usageNetworkStreamTargetsIndex.description: This operation shows the amount of network usage for all stream targets in the account cumulatively and individually. The default time frame is from the last billing date to the end of the current day.

usageNetworkTranscodersIndex.title: Fetch network usage for all transcoders
usageNetworkTranscodersIndex.description: This operation shows the amount of network usage (egress) for all transcoders in the account. The default time frame is from the last billing date to the end of the current day.

usageStoragePeakRecordingIndex.title: Fetch peak recording storage
usageStoragePeakRecordingIndex.description: This operation shows the amount of peak recording storage used for the account. The default time frame is from the last billing date to the end of the current day.

usageTimeTranscodersIndex.title: Fetch stream processing time
usageTimeTranscodersIndex.description: This operation shows the amount of stream processing time used by all transcoders in the account. The default time frame is from the last billing date to the end of the current day.

showViewerDataStreamTarget.title: Fetch viewer data for a stream target
showViewerDataStreamTarget.description: This operation shows viewer data for a specific stream target. The default time frame is from the last billing date to the end of the current day.
